benchmark_details.name: CLC-UKET Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: This paper develops a benchmark for predicting case outcomes in the UK Employment Tribunal (UKET) by creating the CLC-UKET dataset, which consists of approximately 19,000 UKET cases and extensive legal annotations to facilitate multi-class case outcome prediction.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark dataset and evaluate its effectiveness in predicting case outcomes in the UK Employment Tribunal.

data.source: Cambridge Law Corpus (CLC) and UKET judgments
data.annotation: Legal annotations were created using a large language model (LLM) for automatic annotation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the predictions compared to human-annotated outcomes.
methodology.interpretation: A higher F1 score indicates better performance in predicting the correct case outcomes.
methodology.baseline_results: BERT achieved an F1 Score of 0.421, T5 achieved an F1 Score of 0.564, and GPT-4 achieved an F1 Score of 0.549.
methodology.validation: Empirical results were validated against human predictions.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Sensitive personal information is anonymized when necessary.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset is licensed under the Open Government Licence, allowing public usage.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The dataset and its curation comply with relevant ethical and legal standards.
